series_description: This series documents access to all areas of the museum by employees, contractors, and visitors. This series may include, but is not limited to: name, date, sign-in/out times, destination and badge number, after-hours sign-in logs, console logs, badge logs, contractor badge logs, temporary staff badge logs, and key logs.
retention_statement: 10 Years after end of calendar year

series_description: This series documents each purchase, donation, or loan of an object to the museum with regard to its origin, provenance, physical characteristics, condition, and related data. This may include, but is not limited to: accession cards.

This series documents the offer of objects as gifts, bequests, and loans to the museum collection as well as pending object purchases and the justification for the decision for rejection go before the Board of Trustees. This series may include, but not limited to: correspondence, photographs, related research, and shipping and receiving receipts.

series_title: Art Storage Authorization Files and Logs
series_description: This series documents access to the art storage areas of the museum by employees and visitors, and are necessary corollary materials when investigating incident reports. This series may include, but is not limited to: authorization files and logs with accession numbers, description of items, location, name, and date.

series_title: Board of Trustees Meeting Minutes This series consist of meeting proceedings of the board and its committees. Includes materials used to make or support decisions. The Library of Virginia holds the minutes from 1933 1942 on microfilm.

series_description: This series consists of incoming and outgoing letters, memoranda, faxes, notes and their attachments in any format.

This series documents claims filed by the agency for damages related to items in the collection or items loaned to the and are necessary corollary materials when investigating the entire history of a collection item, or an item loaned to the collection. This series may include, but is not limited to: claims, reports, and correspondence.

This series documents the condition of objects within the collection over time and the justification for prioritizing conservation work on the items. This series may include, but is not limited to: item level surveys of specific parts of the collection, i.e., paintings, textiles, furniture; full survey reports; brief condition reports; photographs; slides; and digital images.

This series documents each item accessioned into the collection, whether through purchase, donation, or bequest, is maintained even when the object has been deaccessioned. This series may include, but is not limited to: accession cards, photographs, descriptive information, conservation information including condition reports and treatment history, publication record, exhibition record, related research, photographs, correspondence, requests for photographs, museum label sales information including contracts or deed of gift, and shipping receipts.

This series documents the examination and/or treatment of items that were accessioned, loaned to the museum, or were examined for gift or purchase but ulitmately not accessioned. This series may include, but is not limited to: Documentation includes condition reports, treatment reports, photographs, slides, and digital images.

This series documents correspondence between curators and dealers pertaining to objects offered for viewing and sale. This series may include, but is not limited to: photographs and published catalogs.

This series documents communications to and from the Museum Director. This series may include, but is not limited to: incoming and outgoing letters, memoranda, faxes, notes, and their attachments in any format.
This series documents meeting proceedings, including committee decisions, positions, and events sponsored. This series may include, but is not limited to: minutes.
retention_statement: 10 Years after end of calendar year

series_description: This series documents the major aspects of the service of selected museum docents. This series may include, but is not limited to: accumulated hours, letters of gratitude, special special events, and other important contributions.
This series documents the economic impact of selected museum exhibitions on the greater Richmond community. This series may include, but is not limited to: reports.

This series documents the production of the Economic Impact Study Final Reports. This series may include, but is not limited to: surveys, statistics, and reference notes, used to produce reports on the economic impact of selected museum on the greater Richmond community.
This series documents denied exhibition proposals sent to the museum from other institutions. This series may include, but is not limited to: proposals, correspondence, and meeting notes.
retention_statement: 2 Years after no longer administratively useful

series_description: This series documents accepted proposals for all exhibitions held at the museum, as well as outside exhibitions on which museum collaborated, including information on the exhibitions' shipping, installation, attendance, and publicity. This series include, but is not limited to: correspondence, schedules, shipping and packing instructions, insurance and attendance statistics.

This series documents management of the museum's program for accepted artists. This series may include, but is limited to: applications, correspondence, juror contracts and invoices, examples of artwork, publications, and financial reports.

This series documents denied applications for admission to museum's fellowship program for artists. This series may include, but is not limited to: applications, correspondence, examples of artwork, and publications.

This series documents the activities and operations of the museum Friends Groups. This series may include, but is not limited to: by-laws, minutes, staff liaison files, and material to make or support decisions.

This series documents loans of items to the museum from another institution or individual for exhibitions, as well as items from the museum collection that are loaned to another institution. This series may include, but is not limited to: loan agreement, insurance documents, condition reports, customs information, and shipping and receiving arrangements.

This series documents long-term object loans to the museum collection. This series may include, but is not limited to: accession card copies, correspondence, loan agreements, condition reports, and shipping and receiving receipts.

This series documents requests for loans of items from the museum collection to another institution or individual that were either denied or approved but later rescinded. This series may include, but is not limited to: loan requests, agreements, correspondence, insurance documents, condition reports, schedules, customs information, facility reports, shipping and receiving arrangements, and shipping receipts.
This series documents the marketing and sales of agencyproduced books/catalogues. This series may include, but is limited to: correspondence, sales reports, promotional and reference materials.
retention_statement: 5 Years after no longer administratively useful

series_description: This series documents the permission to publish an image that was granted by the model(s) and any other person appearing that image. This series may include, but is not limited to: agreements and correspondence.
retention_statement: 0 Years after no longer administratively useful

series_description: This series documents the offers of loans, gifts, or bequests to the museum from the public that do not go before the Board of Trustees. This series may include, but is not limited to: museum's response and photographs.

This series documents the movement of items into and out of the painting conservation laboratory and storage area by employees and contractors and acts as necessary corollary information when investigating incident reports. This series include, but is not limited to: logs with accession number, description of item, location, name, and date.

This series documents the process of new object photography from request to completion. This series may include, but is not limited to: general information about the object to be photographed (accession number, artist, title, medium, and dimensions); name of photographer; the date the object was photographed; and formats and quantities provided.
This series documents the production of the agency-produced serial Arts in Virginia. This series may include, but is not to: correspondence, working documents, working proofs, and photographs.

This series documents the production of all agency-related books and catalogues. This series may include, but is not limited to: book proposal, correspondence, research materials, style sheets, photographs, proofs, manuscripts, proofs, schedule, budget costs, print specification bids, and departmental copies of contracts.

This series documents the production of all agency-related collateral, including invitations, promotional material, program brochures, and ads. This series may include, but is not limited to: project request and schedule form, photographs, manuscripts, proofs, and print specifications.

This series documents the production of all agency-related collections and interpretative materials from exhibitions, including gallery guides and exhibition checklists. This series may include, but is not limited to: project requests, manuscripts, and print specifications.

This series documents the development and management of museum programming, including programs for teachers, youth and family, exhibitions, lectures, workshops, symposia, films and concerts, and other public events. This series may but is not limited to: contracts, purchase orders, photographs, publicity, travel arrangements, evaluations and surveys, and schedules.

This series documents art or other property being brought into or out of the museum by visitors or staff. This series may include, but is not limited to: description of property and dates for which the pass is valid.
retention_statement: 2 Years after end of calendar year

series_description: This series consists of copyrighted and non-copyrighted produced publications meant for public distribution

This series documents the fulfillment of requests for reproduction and/or publication of an image of an item in the museum's collection. This series may include, but is not limited to: correspondence, signed contracts, and invoices.

This series documents traveling exhibitions and the items included in each exhibition. This series may include, but is not limited to: correspondence, planning information, schedules, copies of invoices and insurance policies, shipping and information and instructions, checklists, publicity, accession cards, condition reports, loan agreements, and photographs.
This series documents the production of agency-produced magazines. This series may include, but is not limited to: cost-code information, and quantity information.
